PART I.title: THE UNION AND ITS TERRITORY
PART I.explanation: Defines the name of India and describes the states, union territories, and their territorial boundaries.

PART II.title: CITIZENSHIP
PART II.explanation: Explains who is an Indian citizen and how citizenship is acquired or terminated.

PART III.title: FUNDAMENTAL RIGHTS
PART III.explanation: Guarantees basic rights such as equality, freedom, religion, and constitutional remedies to citizens.

PART IV.title: DIRECTIVE PRINCIPLES OF STATE POLICY
PART IV.explanation: Provides guidelines for the State to establish social and economic democracy.

PART V.title: THE UNION
PART V.explanation: Describes the structure, powers, and functions of the Union government.

PART VI.title: THE STATES
PART VI.explanation: Explains the organization, powers, and functioning of State governments.

PART VII.title: - [Omitted]
PART VII.explanation: This Part was removed by a constitutional amendment and is no longer in force.

PART VIII.title: THE UNION TERRITORIES
PART VIII.explanation: Deals with the administration and governance of Union Territories.

PART IX.title: THE PANCHAYATS
PART IX.explanation: Introduces the Panchayati Raj system for rural local self-government.

PART X.title: THE SCHEDULED AND TRIBAL AREAS
PART X.explanation: Provides special administrative provisions for scheduled and tribal areas.

PART XI.title: RELATIONS BETWEEN THE UNION AND THE STATES
PART XI.explanation: Defines legislative, administrative, and financial relations between the Union and States.

PART XII.title: FINANCE, PROPERTY, CONTRACTS AND SUITS
PART XII.explanation: Deals with financial matters, property ownership, contracts, and legal proceedings involving governments.

PART XIII.title: TRADE, COMMERCE AND INTERCOURSE WITHIN THE
PART XIII.explanation: Ensures freedom of trade and commerce throughout the territory of India.

PART XIV.title: SERVICES UNDER THE UNION AND THE STATES
PART XIV.explanation: Regulates recruitment and service conditions of public servants.

PART XV.title: ELECTIONS
PART XV.explanation: Provides for the conduct and supervision of elections in India.

PART XVI.title: SPECIAL PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN CLASSES
PART XVI.explanation: Provides safeguards for Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and other backward classes.

PART XVII.title: OFFICIAL LANGUAGE
PART XVII.explanation: Specifies the official languages of the Union and States.

PART XVIII.title: EMERGENCY PROVISIONS
PART XVIII.explanation: Defines conditions and effects of national, state, and financial emergencies.

PART XIX.title: MISCELLANEOUS
PART XIX.explanation: Contains miscellaneous provisions not covered elsewhere in the Constitution.

PART XX.title: AMENDMENT OF THE CONSTITUTION
PART XX.explanation: Explains the procedure for amending the Constitution of India.

PART XXI.title: TEMPORARY, TRANSITIONAL AND SPECIAL PROVISIONS
PART XXI.explanation: Contains special provisions for certain states and regions.

PART XXII.title: SHORT TITLE, COMMENCEMENT, AUTHORITATIVE TEXT
PART XXII.explanation: Provides the name, commencement date, and authoritative text of the Constitution.

PART IV-A.title: FUNDAMENTAL DUTIES
PART IV-A.explanation: Lists the moral duties of citizens towards the nation.

PART IX-A.title: THE MUNICIPALITIES
PART IX-A.explanation: Establishes urban local self-government through municipalities.

PART IX-B.title: THE CO-OPERATIVE SOCIETIES
PART IX-B.explanation: Provides constitutional status and regulation of cooperative societies.
